Battery.definition: the crime or tort of intentionally or recklessly causing offensive physical contact or bodily harm
Battery.origin: [Old French batterie beating, from battre to beat, from Latin battuere ]

aggravated battery.definition: criminal battery that is accompanied by aggravating factors

sub_terms.a: criminal battery that causes or is intended to cause serious bodily injury esp. through the use of a dangerous weapon
sub_terms.b: criminal battery committed on a protected person (as a minor or a police officer) comparein this entry

aggravated battery.note: Aggravated battery is usually classified as a felony.

sex·u·al battery.definition: intentional and offensive sexual contact and esp. sexual intercourse with a person who has not given or (as in the case of a child) is incapable of giving consentforced or coerced contact with the sexual parts of either the victim or the perpetrator see also
sex·u·al battery.note: This is a broad definition of the offense. The specific elements of this crime vary from state to state, and some states use more narrow definitions.

simple battery.definition: criminal battery that is not accompanied by aggravating factors (as a dangerous weapon) comparein this entry
simple battery.note: Simple battery is usually classified as a misdemeanor.
